author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Pep Guardiola says Manchester City are back to their best after West Ham FA Cup demolition
text:
Sport Pep Guardiola says Manchester City are back to their best after West Ham FA Cup demolition The Spaniard saw his side thrash the Hammers 5-0 at the London Stadium as they eased into the fourth round Share Guardiola was delighted with his side's performance (Photo: Dan Mullan)   Thank you for subscribing!   
Pep Guardiola claimed Manchester City are back to their best after they stormed into the FA Cup fourth round. 
Rampant City tore woeful West Ham apart at the London Stadium to cruise through to the next round. 
And boss Guardiola said: “The way we play finally we recovered what we did at the start of the season. 
“In the last month, two months, for different circumstances, we were not able to do that but hopefully we can start again to play in that [way]. City were in fine form at the London Stadium (Photo: Nigel French/PA) 
“It’s the only way in this kind of team. We are not strong enough, like the other ones. We are not fast enough, like the other ones. 
“We have to try to play with the ball, as much as possible, to win the games. If not, all the other contenders are stronger than us. 
“We can’t achieve our targets if we don’t play - and to play is to keep the ball.” The loss was West Ham's worst ever at home in the FA Cup (Photo: Ian Walton) 
City sent West Ham tumbling to their worst ever home defeat in the FA Cup. 
They went ahead after being awarded a controversial penalty by referee Michael Oliver when Pablo Zabaleta tumbled over in the box after colliding with Angelo Ogbonna. 
Slaven Bilic labelled the penalty as “soft” and the Hammers boss added: “The penalty was a very important point of the game, but it is hard to talk about that when you lose 5-0.” Bilic rued to first-half penalty decision (Photo: Ian Walton) 
He added: “It’s very bad night for us. It’s hard to say anything positive when you have been beaten 5-0 at home. 
“Now it’s time for the team to show character. Fortunately we have had a few defeats like that. Bilic couldn't find anything positive from the performance (Photo: Dan Mullan) 
“After the Arsenal (5-1) one we showed character, quality and team spirit and went to Liverpool and after that game we had 10 points from four games. 
“Now it is time to do it again.” poll loading Should West Ham sack Slaven Bilic? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
